meanings.definition: A person who boasts or brags about their achievements or possessions.
meanings.sent1: She always talks about her accomplishments, making her one of the biggest boasters in the group.
meanings.sent2: The room was filled with boasters, each trying to outdo the other with their stories.
meanings.sent3: The boasters at the party were like peacocks showing off their feathers.
meanings.sent4: His loud boasting made him stand out like a neon sign among the modest crowd of friends.
meanings.sent5: The boasters in the office were like noisy sirens, always drawing attention to themselves.

meanings.definition: The act of boasting or bragging.
meanings.sent1: His constant boasters about his new car became tiresome to everyone around him.
meanings.sent2: The boasters in the room made it hard to distinguish truth from exaggeration.
meanings.sent3: The boasters in the competition were like colorful balloons, inflating their achievements.
meanings.sent4: Her boasters echoed in the room like thunder, demanding attention from all.
meanings.sent5: The loud boasters in the restaurant were like a noisy orchestra, each trying to play the loudest instrument.
